snippet: Officials in cities like Philadelphia, Chicago and Washington are being met with anger and criticism as they close schools citing budgets.
abstract: News analysis; school districts around the country are using rationale to close doors of low performing schools that it is not cost effective to keep them open; critics say while test scores or spreadsheets may say one thing, even lower-performing, underused schools can serve as refuges in communities that have little else.

byline.original: By MOTOKO RICH and JON HURDLE

lead_paragraph: Officials in cities like Philadelphia, Chicago and Washington are being met with anger and criticism as they close schools citing budgets.

headline.seo: Rational Decisions and Heartbreak on School Closings
headline.main: Rational Decisions and Heartbreak on School Closings
headline.print_headline: Rational Decisions And Heartbreak On School Closings
